channel.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
channel.description:
So there is this online DVD store company from my country which delivers CDs/DVDs by first ordering them from sources such as Amazon and other stores and then shipping to my country address.
Now first of all when I ordered the product, on the page the price was saying 35 leva (~$22). Yesterday when I checked my mail after making my order a week ago I got a message from them saying that the DVD will be delivered to my home. They have quoted the e-mail I sent with the order which still contained the product link, I accidentally clicked it and when I saw it, it was saying 50 leva. That's way too much. Now I'm quite afraid that they might say that I ordered the DVD in the price 50 leva, but I actually ordered it while it was saying 35 leva in the product description. I e-mailed them back and even sent them a message on Skype asking about if the old price still counts but I still haven't gotten a reply back.
Now incase the DVD arrives and I get costed 50 leva for it, and I refuse to pay, and if I happen to get "sued" do I have any chance of proving that they did a fraud?
I have ordered from them in the past btw and once I ordered the first DVD, I noticed a price change on the same product link, it must be because they are using a different source once the first one is being shipped, and they are replacing it with another one which seems to cost more, so I'm hoping it's the same case here. What are your thoughts?

item.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mitko, post:12, topic:458548”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=561462.msg4098433#msg4098433 date=1347145682]
not sure in bulgaria it is the same…

but in America you ALWAYS have like 2-3 business days to return an item.
[/quote]Well what if the item did not come from their stock? I mean first he ordered it probably off the US to his office and then he will deliver it to my home with a courier. If I decline the item, he would be in money loss?[/quote]
I don’t think that matters. They are most certainly breaking EU law already, so if they don’t want it returned, you have a case against them.

Read full topic

item.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

Alright well thanks for the tips guys. I still find it weird how he answered a few of my questions on Skype yesterday about delivery yet when I finally asked about total price, he never replied.

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:10, topic:458548”]who buys dvds lol[/quote]When you desperately want to see something which is not available on the net in DVD-R or even DVDRip you are forced to buy it.

Read full topic

item.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m not generally sure about law over their but from general awareness you can say this.
Companies have a reputation, if you claim they make a mistake (better yet you provide proof that they did) they will usually say that’s fine and offer you the product at the original price and give you it. If that’s not the case do not pay them and give them the item back and let them know you will not be ordering from them again.
Usually any big company cares about you coming back as a lot of companies profits are from returning customers. Hope I helped although I don’t feel like I have haha

Read full topic

item.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Mitko, post:7, topic:458548”][quote author=Niall link=topic=561462.msg4096020#msg4096020 date=1346840674]
have you been charged anything yet?
[/quote]Not yet, I pay when it arrives at home. Now that I’ve gotten the e-mail that means in about 3 days they will probably call me to notify me when to wait at home for the delivery.

Luckaly Google still has the old page cached which displays the old price, that could be of help.[/quote]

under the eu distance selling regulations you have a right to cancel your contract within 7 days for any reason at all, when the deliveries come don’t open them as this could hinder some options you have

Read full topic

I recommend you hire a Lawyer with a $10 retainer.

item.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I think you should be safe. What you should NOT do, is to refuse to pay and keep the product.
Maybe you should buy it directly from Amazon next time?

Read full topic

item.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:2, topic:458548”]I think nobody here have any knowledge about Bulgarian law. (You are Bulgarian right?) So I would suggest that you check up this yourselves.

This might help you: http://europa.eu/youth/your_rights/as_a_consumer/index_bg_en.html[/quote]Thanks for the reply but no one seems to reply to their problems there a lot.

In my previous order, I got an e-mail reply similar to this:
“Hello,
At monday a courier from Speedy will deliver you ### 1 x 27 leva + 3 leva delivery fee.
Thanks,
Greetings, ###.”

But on this order, I got no info about the price and shipping. Instead, I just got an e-mail containing
“Hello,
it will be delivered.
Thanks.
Greetings, ###”.

Something smells fishy.

Read full topic

item.title: [Law question] DVD order fraud?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I think nobody here have any knowledge about Bulgarian law. (You are Bulgarian right?) So I would suggest that you check up this yourselves.

This might help you: http://europa.eu/youth/your_rights/as_a_consumer/index_bg_en.html

Read full topic
